issue.title: fix: move @kurkle/color to dependencies

repository.name: Chart.js
repository.description: Simple HTML5 Charts using the <canvas> tag

issue.body:
fixes #10915

<!--
Please consider the following before submitting a pull request:

Guidelines for contributing: https://github.com/chartjs/Chart.js/blob/master/docs/developers/contributing.md

Example of changes on an interactive website such as the following:
- https://jsbin.com/
- https://jsfiddle.net/
- https://codepen.io/pen/
- Premade template: https://codepen.io/pen?template=wvezeOq
-->

body: Hello. I`m getting the same error using 4.3.0.
Me too having the same error in 4.3.0
FYI: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/74853338/migration-chart-js-with-zoom-plugin-and-moment-adapter proposes a fix with the UMD bundle.

I've tried a lot of ways to import the latest chart.js. All fail with this error and I can see no way around it.
```
import Chart from 'https://cdn.skypack.dev/chart.js'
import Chart from 'https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/chart.js@4.4.0/dist/
rt.js'
import Chart from 'https://unpkg.com/chart.js@4.4.0/dist/chart.js'
import Chart from 'https://unpkg.com/chart.js@3.6.1/auto/auto.esm.js'
import Chart from '../../node_modules/chart.js/dist/chart.js'
```

Should I use an earlier version? What would be a good version to use? It should  be in the 4.0 and above, and have a cjs version.

Thanks! Great library!

unpkg shows:
https://unpkg.com/browse/chart.js@4.4.0/dist/chart.js
.. as having 
import '@kurkle/color';
.. which fails due to not having a legal import source, @kurkle/color

This leads me to believe chart.js requires using webpack or similar to convert to a legal import. Or possibly there is an <script type="importmap"> somewhere?

Oh, and @LeeLenaleee (thanks for the pointers) the first two fail due to being illegal formats, and the last (legal too!) fails:
import {Chart, registerables} from 'https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/chart.js@4.4.0/dist/chart.js';
yields:
Uncaught TypeError: Failed to resolve module specifier "@kurkle/color". Relative references must start with either "/", "./", or "../".

All this leads me that there is a broken build that did not manage bare imports?

Could we re-open this until chart.js manages imports correctly?
I hope all goes well, this is GREAT project!

The esm build is meant to be used with a bundler like webpack. I thought I still might work that skypack or other online frameworks did some magic.

If you want to use it from online you need the UMD build.

You can also try to import kurkle/color from online first. Maby it can resolve it then but otherwise you will need to use the UMD build

Sigh. There are many of us who do not need elaborate workflow, our repos don't require it and we prefer the simplicity of Vanilla Javascript.

And I have not yet used a repo that required said workflow. But I trust you, that you find it necessary to do as you have done.

So I think this results in a new issue: documentation: directions on how to use webpack (which _is_ pretty nifty) to do as you describe, ending up with an esm version of chart.js that can be used by Vanilla JS users. My guess is that the bare import conversion will do the trick. Maybe an importmap?

It may already be in the docs but I haven't found it. 

And thanks again for the wonderful product!

@backspaces to use chart.js without any kind of bundler, the file to import is https://unpkg.com/browse/chart.js@4.4.0/dist/chart.umd.js

You shouldn't need to handle registering any components in that case because the UMD build includes it all

Thanks for the quick response! 

Unless I am mistaken umd's are not esm compatible .. i.e. cannot be used by a esm module with imports. 

But maybe I can use rollup to convert the umd to an esm? That should be reasonably easily documented.
I'm not sure of the intricacies of UMD builds mixed with esm imports, but I think you are correct that out of the box it wouldn't work.

issue.title: CDN version of the plain (esm) chart.js cannot be imported?

repository.name: Chart.js
repository.description: Simple HTML5 Charts using the <canvas> tag

issue.body:
### Expected behavior

I expected to be able to import `Chart` from the CDN url https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/Chart.js/4.4.0/chart.js

### Current behavior

`Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: The specifier @kurkle/color was a bare specifier, but was not remapped to anything. Relative module specifiers must start with ./, ../ or /.`

### Reproducible sample

no full example necessary

### Optional extra steps/info to reproduce

Open a dev console and run `import("https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/Chart.js/4.4.0/chart.js").then(lib => console.log(lib))`. It'll error out.

### Possible solution

_No response_

### Context

https://www.chartjs.org/docs/latest/getting-started/installation.html suggests that if you don't want to use npm (for instance, you're working on a "classic" web page that's just static HTML, CSS, and JS) you can use one of several CDNs with CDNJS listed as first option, so that's what folks will most likely go for. 

https://www.chartjs.org/docs/latest/getting-started/integration.html then teaches people that it's an ES module so `import` works out of the box, and so we run into a problem because instead it errors out.

### chart.js version

4.4.0

### Browser name and version

n/a

### Link to your project

n/a
